DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic, Therapeutic, or Research Equipment Clinical Study Sponsor Requirement Qualifiying Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indication of whether or not diagnostic, therapeutic or research equipment met the sponsor's requirements for use in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Device Events Domain Diagnostic, Therapeutic, or Research Equipment Clinical Study Sponsor Requirement Qualifying
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to device events._A manufactured object that is used to perform diagnostic, therapeutic or research activities._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory._Success in satisfying a test or requirement.

The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. Concepts.definition: A manufactured object that is used to perform diagnostic, therapeutic or research activities.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
Success in satisfying a test or requirement.
